answers.answer: No its not bad.  Its quite common

Well it depends you shoyld ask your doctor my doctor changede to a different doctor im 34 weeks but the baby is measuring 36 weeks so I might have baby before mu due date and since im already having a lot of cramping back bain and vaginal pain it looks like im gonna be due in 4 weeks or before but its not always bad my doctor just told me he was measuring ahead but that he was healthy somwtimes your due date is off by a week or two but inless your doctor says is bad or something wrong you shouldnt worry girl...
I've been measuring 2 weeks ahead sence I was 32 weeks an now I'm 4 days over due my midwives told me she might just be a big baby
Im measuring 4 weeks ahead and im known to have large children. You might just be one of the lucky ones to have a bigger baby. I wouldn't worry.

Much better to measure ahead as opposed to behind! They weren't sure on my due date because I was on the pill and didn't get regular periods, then at my anatomy u/s they changed my due date two weeks later! I always wondered if the original due date could have actually been accurate,  but they said they take a lot more into consideration than just size.

Omg im scared of having a huge baby bit I doubt it Ihave a lot of fluid and tjeu measured me like 3 weeks ago and said baby only weigged 4.5 pounds now im not so sure but hopefully hes nlt too big so I can habe him normal...
I'm scared his Ganna be so big I won't be able to have him normal!Does this mean I have gestational diabetes ? :(I did my glucose test about 4 weeks ago & was never told about my results ...
I've been measuring 2 weeks ahead since 16 weeks. And at my 36 week appointment I was measuring 4 weeks ahead. It's not a bad thing. You may just have a big baby
I had a ten pound baby vaginal and it wasnt that bad. I have diabetes but that's not a huge fact in why my kids are so large.
Thanks girls ,  I'm praying is nothing bad . Hopefully is just that I'm having a big baby. Lol

Big babies are great, they sleep better! Also, ultrasound measurements get less accurate the further along you are. So many people are encouraged to induce earlier (which can lead to more complications in birth) simply due to a late ultrasound that says their baby is 10 pounds. After they're put through intense artificial labour (or induction) and meet their nice little average 8 pounder they wonder what all the stupid fuss was about. And btw I had a 10 pounder for my first. Easy as pie. If by pie you mean 42km marathon. But I still enjoyed the birth :)

question: I'm 30 weeks pregnant , 31 weeks tomarrow & went in for a 3D/4D ultrasound on Saturday to have a better view of my love bugs chubby face ( by the way he looks just like ME!!!!) lol thought he was Ganna look like daddy since he's my first & usually the first one looks like daddy but he has more of my features.But anyways hes measuring 2 weeks ahead !! I was surprised . Is this a bad thing ?
title: Measuring ahead ?
